intro: Stenostephanus sprucei, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
